filmography.title: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
filmography.role_description: A weak-willed district attorney trapped in a loveless marriage by a dark secret from his childhood; Douglas's film debut.
filmography.plot: A man returns to his hometown and uncovers the dark secrets of a wealthy couple who were his childhood friends.

filmography.title: Out of the Past
filmography.role_description: A charming but dangerous gangster who drags a former private investigator back into a web of betrayal.
filmography.plot: A private eye escapes his past to run a gas station in a small town, but his past catches up with him.

filmography.title: I Walk Alone
filmography.role_description: A sleek, treacherous nightclub owner who betrays his former bootlegging partner when he gets out of prison.
filmography.plot: An ex-con returns to collect his share of a bootlegging operation from his former partner, who has gone legit.

filmography.title: A Letter to Three Wives
filmography.role_description: A cynical but loving schoolteacher husband who refuses to conform to his wife's social climbing ambitions.
filmography.plot: A letter from the town flirt claims she has run off with one of three women's husbands, but doesn't say which one.

filmography.title: Champion
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, ambitious boxer who alienates everyone who cares about him on his violent rise to the top.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous boxer fights his way to the top, but eventually alienates all of the people who helped him on the way up.

filmography.title: Young Man with a Horn
filmography.role_description: A talented but troubled jazz trumpeter whose obsession with music leads to a personal downward spiral.
filmography.plot: A young trumpet player rises to fame but struggles with the pressures of his personal life and career.

filmography.title: Ace in the Hole
filmography.role_description: A cynical, disgraced journalist who manipulates a mine rescue operation to create a media sensation.
filmography.plot: A frustrated former big-city journalist now stuck in Albuquerque exploits a story about a man trapped in a cave to jump-start his career.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best International Award

filmography.title: Detective Story
filmography.role_description: A rigid, unforgiving police detective whose black-and-white view of the world destroys his marriage and career.
filmography.plot: A bitter police detective tracks an abortionist while his own marriage crumbles due to his rigid morality.

filmography.title: The Big Sky
filmography.role_description: A frontiersman who joins a keelboat expedition up the Missouri River, finding adventure and conflict.
filmography.plot: A keelboat expedition travels up the Missouri River to trade with the Blackfoot Indians.

filmography.title: The Bad and the Beautiful
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, manipulative movie producer who uses his friends to achieve success, only to be rejected by them.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous movie producer alienates a director, an actress, and a writer while making them stars.

filmography.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
filmography.role_description: A harpooner who becomes a reluctant guest aboard Captain Nemo's submarine, the Nautilus.
filmography.plot: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine Nautilus commanded by Captain Nemo.

filmography.title: Ulysses
filmography.role_description: The mythological Greek hero who faces gods and monsters on his perilous ten-year journey home.
filmography.plot: The hero of the Trojan War battles mythical creatures and the gods themselves to return home to his faithful wife.

filmography.title: Lust for Life
filmography.role_description: The passionate, tormented Dutch painter whose intense devotion to his art leads to madness and tragedy.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of the brilliant but tortured Dutch painter Vincent van Gogh.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
filmography.role_description: The tubercular, gambling dentist and gunfighter who forms a loyal friendship with Wyatt Earp.
filmography.plot: Lawman Wyatt Earp and outlaw Doc Holliday form an unlikely alliance which culminates in their participation in the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

filmography.title: Paths of Glory
filmography.role_description: A principled French colonel who defends three of his soldiers against charges of cowardice in a corrupt military court.
filmography.plot: After a failed attack on a German anthill during WWI, a general orders three soldiers chosen at random to be court-martialed for cowardice.

filmography.title: The Vikings
filmography.role_description: A fierce, one-eyed Viking warrior who battles his half-brother for the throne and the love of a princess.
filmography.plot: Einar and Eric are two half-brothers and rivals for the throne of Northumbria and the love of Princess Morgana.
filmography.awards: San Sebastián Int'l Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Last Train from Gun Hill
filmography.role_description: A determined marshal who travels to a hostile town to arrest the son of an old friend for the murder of his wife.
filmography.plot: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend to justice for the rape and murder of his wife.

filmography.title: Spartacus
filmography.role_description: A Thracian gladiator who leads a massive slave uprising against the Roman Republic.
filmography.plot: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

filmography.title: Lonely Are the Brave
filmography.role_description: A fiercely independent modern-day cowboy who refuses to conform to society and becomes a fugitive.
filmography.plot: A cowboy refuses to adjust to modern society and gets himself thrown in jail to help a friend escape.

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: A Marine colonel who uncovers a plot by military leaders to overthrow the President of the United States.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty.

filmography.title: In Harm's Way
filmography.role_description: A troubled naval officer seeking redemption and trying to reconnect with his estranged son during WWII.
filmography.plot: A naval officer reprimanded after Pearl Harbor is later promoted to rear admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor (for this and others)

filmography.title: The War Wagon
filmography.role_description: A gunfighter hired by his former enemy to help rob an armored stagecoach transporting gold.
filmography.plot: A rancher shoots a man who tried to kill him and then hires him to help steal a shipment of gold from a corrupt businessman.

filmography.title: The Fury
filmography.role_description: A desperate father and government agent trying to rescue his psychic son from a secret agency.
filmography.plot: A government agent is determined to rescue his son, who possesses psychic powers, from a secret government agency.

filmography.title: The Final Countdown
filmography.role_description: The commander of a modern aircraft carrier that is mysteriously transported back in time to the eve of the Pearl Harbor attack.
filmography.plot: A modern aircraft carrier is thrown back in time to 1941 near Hawaii, just hours before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

filmography.title: The Man from Snowy River
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing both a wealthy cattle station owner and his eccentric, one-legged miner brother.
filmography.plot: A young man tries to prove his worth as a stockman and win the hand of the station owner's daughter.

filmography.title: Tough Guys
filmography.role_description: An elderly train robber released from prison after 30 years who struggles to adapt to the 1980s before planning one last heist.
filmography.plot: Two elderly gangsters are released from prison after 30 years and try to adjust to the 1980s, but eventually decide to pull one last job.
